result.execSummary:
The defendant Keon I Ferguson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Uttering a Forgery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
2 days jail credit if revoked.

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: No contact with B.K. or P.N. or their residence.

Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Stayed pending further order of the court, Huber and Electronic Monitoring is granted in available.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keon I Ferguson

records.addlTxt:
Restitution Ordered in the amount of $1,086.08
Plus 10% Restitution Surcharge
Proposed Restitution Ordered

9:45 AM case called. Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Keon I Ferguson appeared by video, in custody from Jackson Correctional.  Attorney Katherine Cook appeared by video for Keon I Ferguson. Agreement has been reached. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant waives right to a personal appearance, Court accepts waiver. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. Defendant waives right to a jury trial. 

Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Uttering a Forgery with Repeater. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.

Court withholds sentence and orders 18 months probation, 90 days jail stayed pending further order of the court with Huber and Electronic Monitoring if available.

Conditions of probation:
No contact with B.K. or P.N or their residences.
Restitution of $1,194.68 (includes 10% surcharge)
Costs
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
2 days of jail credit if revoked.

Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
Defendant's Waiver of Personal Appearance
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachment)
Arraignment on October 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Same as Complaint.

1:40 PM case called. Defendant Keon I Ferguson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Keon I Ferguson.  Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
State calls Officer Thomas Ramboldt to testify- is sworn and testifies. Court takes judicial notice of bonds in Chippewa County files 21CF2032 and 20CF618. 
Record to reflect identification of the defendant by Officer Ramboldt. Cross examination by the Defense. 
Witness is released. State asks for bind over. Defense argues against bind over. State responds. 
Court finds probable cause and binds matter over to Branch 2 to schedule ARGN.

9:56 AM Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Keon I Ferguson. Defendant is In jail and not brought over.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
